org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.layouts.flowlayout

Class VerticalFlowLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.server.AbstractClientConnector
      • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
        • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponentContainer
          • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractLayout
            • com.vaadin.ui.CssLayout

                • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.layouts.flowlayout.VerticalFlowLayout
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.event.LayoutEvents.LayoutClickNotifier, com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.server.ClientConnector, com.vaadin.server.Sizeable, com.vaadin.shared.Connector, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.ComponentContainer, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents, com.vaadin.ui.HasComponents.ComponentAttachDetachNotifier, com.vaadin.ui.Layout, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Iterable<com.vaadin.ui.Component>

    public class VerticalFlowLayout
extends AbstractFlowLayout
    Vertical flow layout implementation - inner components are placed one under another, each displayed to its full height (may vary). If the element would exceed the height of the container, the element is placed in the next "column" even if the container's width would be exceeded (container doesn't expand to fit the content).
    Author:
    SkyCrawl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
